taxonomicnotes: Lepidocephalichthys annandalei was described from Mahananda River at Siliguri and Tista River near Jalpaiguri, West Bengal.
rationale: Lepidocephalichthys annandalei is distributed throughout the hill streams of the Ganges and Brahmaputra basins, with no major threats and is assessed as Least Concern.
evaluator: Rema Devi, K.R., Arunachalam, M., Dahanukar, N., Allen, D.J., Daniel, B.A. & Molur, S.

taxonomicnotes: Lepidocephalus caudofurcatus Tilak & Husain, 1978 is considered a synonym of Lepidocephalichthys annandalei Chaudhuri 1912.  However, further work is required to confirm this.
rationale:
Lepidocephalichthys menoni is a valid species and as currently accepted it has a widespread range throughout much of the Ganges and Brahmaputra basins. The species does require further taxonomic study and it is currently synonomysed with Lepidocephalichthys annandalei Chaudhuri 1912. It was first described from a type locality in the Brahmaputra basin (Meghalaya) appears relatively scarce within the Brahmaputra; there are recent records only from Assam and from Arunachal Pradesh (2002).

The species is assessed as Data Deficient due to the taxonomic uncertainty at present. However, degradation due to deforestation leading to sedimentation is common across much of the range, and the impact of dams, of which there are many current or planned in hill areas within India, is uncertain, and the species may qualify for a threatened category if its range proves to be restricted to the Brahmaputra basin, and it should be re-assessed if this taxonomic revision is undertaken.
evaluator: Budha, P.B., Mitra, T.R., Barbhuiya, A.H., Nguyen, T.H.T., Jha, B.R., Kakkasery, F., Rema Devi, K.R., Dahanukar, N., Vishwanath, W., Ng, H.H., Allen, D.J. & Daniel, B.A.
